p.strong: This component is only available until version 1.01.xx. In Hippo 7.9 similar functionality is available in the core. See Repository Scheduler service

subsection.name: SchedulerDaemon implements DaemonModule
subsection.p: With the SchedulerDaemon you are able to implement Quartz jobs in your project and schedule them in the repository by configuration.
subsection.h5: Step 1: add the SchedulerDaemon to the content module
subsection.p: In manifestEntries of the maven-jar-plugin in the content jar's pom, add the SchedulerDaemon as Hippo Module:
subsection.h5: Step 2: add SchedulerDaemon configuration to the repository
subsection.p: Scheduler configuration is present as a node of type scheduler:scheduler in the repository. Add such node in your content module as xml, with of course the accompanying reference in hippoecm-extension.xml
subsection.source: <sv:node xmlns:sv="http://www.jcp.org/jcr/sv/1.0" sv:name="demoScheduler"> <sv:property sv:name="jcr:primaryType" sv:type="Name"> <sv:value>scheduler:scheduler</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="scheduler:active" sv:type="Boolean"> <sv:value>true</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:node sv:name="demoJobSchedulerGroup"> <sv:property sv:name="jcr:primaryType" sv:type="Name"> <sv:value>scheduler:jobScheduleGroup</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="scheduler:active" sv:type="Boolean"> <sv:value>true</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:node sv:name="demoJobSchedule"> <sv:property sv:name="jcr:primaryType" sv:type="Name"> <sv:value>scheduler:jobSchedule</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="scheduler:active" sv:type="Boolean"> <sv:value>true</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="scheduler:jobClassName" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>org.onehippo.forge.utilities.repository.scheduler.tester.TesterJob</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="scheduler:runInstantly" sv:type="Boolean"> <sv:value>false</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="scheduler:cronExpression" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>0 0/1 * 1/1 * ? *</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:node sv:name="scheduler:jobConfiguration">..[see example xml]..</sv:node> </sv:node> </sv:node> </sv:node>
subsection.h5: Step 3: activate the scheduler in properties
subsection.p:
On behalf of clustered setup, the scheduler reads from a properties file to activate or not. You can specify a properties file with a system property
-Dscheduler.properties or by adding a file project.properties to the classpath, e.g. in the CMS's resources directory. Note that if the property file is not found, the scheduler is deactivated. In the file, add the following property:
subsection.source: # alternative to having this built-in resource file is to provide it by means # of the following system property: -Dscheduler.properties org.onehippo.forge.utilities.repository.scheduler.SchedulerDaemon.active=true
subsection.h5: Step 4: write and configure your own job.
subsection.p: The example configuration configures the TesterJob. It does nothing but read and log it's configuration. Once you see it up and running, you are ready to write your own job, extending from org.onehippo.forge.utilities.repository.scheduler.BaseJob
